intro: Baphia kirkii subsp. kirkii, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive red and orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental tree in tropical and subtropical regions.
